DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - Compare effect usual care mail intervention v Cancer Information Service ( CIS ) support mail intervention likelihood woman abnormal Pap test keep medical follow-up appointment satisfied talk provider . OUTLINE : This multicenter study . Patients randomize 1 2 intervention arm . - Arm I ( Usual-care mailing intervention ) : Patients receive generic letter remind follow-up colposcopy appointment . - Arm II ( Cancer Information Service [ CIS ] support mail intervention ) : Patients receive target letter remind follow-up colposcopy appointment , ask someone designate call CIS , suggest question ask CIS colposcopies Pap test . At follow-up appointment , patient undergo exit interview compare patient satisfaction 2 intervention . Patients arm II also answer question CIS experience , intervention make follow-up visit less difficult .
